He'll always be different.
translation.ko: 그는 언제나 특별한 사람으로 남을 거예요

translation.en: After Samantha's table dance last night... ...a shroud of embarrassment surrounds the White House.
translation.ko: 사만다의 테이블 댄스 사건 이후로 백악관은 당황하고 있습니다

translation.en: Let's go live to Jeff as he tells us about her alleged affair.
translation.ko: 생방송으로 연결해 제프로부터 이번 사건에 대해 들어보겠습니다

translation.en: The White House has no comment... ...regarding a jealous brawl involving Samantha Mackenzie.
translation.ko: 사만다 소동에 대해 백악관에선 아무런 언급이 없으며

translation.en: Nor do they have anything to say about her relationship... ...with her secret-service agent.
translation.ko: 비밀요원과의 관계에 대해서도 침묵을 지키고 있습니다

translation.en: Reporting live from Redmond University...
What are you doing here?
The question on my mind, Samantha, is what have you been doing here?
translation.ko: 내가 하고 싶은 질문은 네가 여기서 무슨 짓을 했냐는 거다

translation.en: There's been a three-point drop in the polls since your little table dance.
translation.ko: 네 테이블 댄스 이후로 여론 조사에서 3포인트 하락했어

translation.en: Was I that bad? You've gotta know we are in the race of our lives.
translation.ko: - 내가 한 짓이 그렇게 나빴어요? - 우린 늘 경쟁 속에서 살잖니

translation.en: We were elected to set an example.
They expect more of us.
That's the life we've chosen.
I didn't choose anything, Mom.
And I didn't run for anything. Nobody elected me, remember?
translation.ko: 난 출마한 적도 없고 누가 날 뽑은 적도 없잖아요?

translation.en: Like it or not, chosen or not...
...you are the daughter of the president of the United States.
Your father and I need you. Now.
We need to be the first family.
You want me to leave school?
When President Harding was elected...
...Florence Harding said, "Warren, I got you the presidency.
translation.ko: 그 부인은 이렇게 말했지 '우리가 당신을 대통령으로 만들었어요'

translation.en: Now what are you gonna do with it?"
So let's get your father the presidency. Again.
translation.ko: 그러니 우리도 아버지를 한 번 더 대통령으로 만들어 드리자

translation.en: See what he does with it.
It's his time.
You're asking me to join the campaign.
I'm not asking.
Good evening, Miss.
I guess you heard Samantha, raising money for her dad's re-election... ...one dollar at a time.
translation.ko: 사만다가 아버지의 재선을 위해 춤 한 번에 1불씩 모금했다죠

translation.en: Yes. That's the big story. Here's the best part.
The agent who knocked out the guy at the bar where Samantha was stripping?
translation.ko: 그녀가 춤추는 곳에 있었던 사람을 요원이 때려눕혔단 게 압권이죠?

translation.en: Turns out that secret service agent is her boyfriend.
With the help of hard-working people like you we can win this thing. Thank you, Motor City.
translation.ko: 여러분의 도움과 수고 덕분에 우린 승리할 겁니다

translation.en: Mackenzie! Mackenzie! Mackenzie! Mackenzie! Mackenzie! Mackenzie!
We're here to discuss your proposed removal... ...as a disciplinary action.
translation.ko: 우린 자네의 징계문제에 대해 논의하기 위해 모였네

translation.en: Your record is exceptional, but looking at this report... ...I have my doubts about your ability to continue as an agent.
translation.ko: 자네 경력은 뛰어나지만 이번 일로 요원으로서의 능력이 의심스러워

translation.en: I understand. So please tell this panel why we should allow you to continue as an agent?
translation.ko: - 이해합니다 - 계속 요원 일을 하려는 이유는 뭔가?

translation.en: My father was an agent and my grandfather was bef-- But they're not the ones under review here. You are.
translation.ko: - 아버지도, 조부도 요원이셨고... - 문제는 그분들이 아니라 자네야

translation.en: If you had a different father or grandfather, you wouldn't have this opportunity.
translation.ko: 자네 부친이나 조부가 아니었다면 이런 기회를 얻지도 못했을 걸세

translation.en: You know, as a little kid...
...I always dreamt about standing on the sidelines of history, protecting others.
translation.ko: 요인들을 보호하며 역사를 지켜보는 제 자신을 늘 꿈꿨죠

translation.en: Maybe even the president himself.
...I had the opportunity to protect a pretty remarkable person.
Do you have anything to say to defend your actions?
You trained me to expect the unexpected and I tried not to feel anything.
translation.ko: 예상치 못한 일에 대비하라고 훈련받았고 냉정해지려 애썼어요

translation.en: I tried to keep my distance, but I--
Fell deeper.
And deeper.
If having those feelings means losing my job...
translation.ko: 그런 감정 때문에 직업을 잃게 된다면

translation.en: ...then that's a loss I am prepared to take.
You and I know that mistakes made in our line of work could mean someone's life.
translation.ko: 경호 임무에선 실수란 한 사람의 목숨을 잃게 하는 일일 수 있네

translation.en: I'm sorry.
You'll be on suspension pending your removal.
translation.ko: 자넨 해직될 때까지 직무 정지 상태로 있게 돼

translation.en: And you should start to think about other alternatives.
translation.ko: 그러니 다른 직업을 생각해둬야 할 것 같네

translation.en: -...his sense of humor, his charisma... -Did we confirm these numbers?
translation.ko: - 그의 유머 감각, 그의 카리스마... - 이 수치들을 확인했나요?

translation.en: And did she sign for them?
-That's why we chose this venue. -...New Hampshire...
translation.ko: - 그래서 우리가 이 지역을 택한 거야 - 뉴햄프셔...

translation.en: We're not in New Hampshire any more. These people wanna hear about foreign markets.
translation.ko: 여긴 뉴햄프셔가 아니에요, 이들은 해외시장 얘길 듣고 싶어해요

translation.en: -Hey. How are you doing? -Good.
You okay?
You're unhappy. I get it.
But if you're gonna be here, be here.
translation.ko: 하지만 여기 있을 거면 제대로 처신해라

translation.en: Because there's a lot at stake and I really need you to act like a grown-up right now.
translation.ko: 중요한 일이 많고 이제 네가 성인답게 행동해줬으면 해

translation.en: Obviously I understand there is a lot at stake, Dad.
translation.ko: 중요한 일이 많다는 건 저도 분명하게 이해해요

translation.en: I have been standing by your side with Mom my entire life.
translation.ko: 난 평생 동안 엄마와 함께 아빠를 도왔어요

translation.en: That's why I came home.
You don't have to tell me how important it is to be with the people you love. I am here.
translation.ko: 그러니 함께 있는 게 얼마나 중요한지 말할 필요 없어요, 제가 왔잖아요

translation.en: If you want me to be a grown-up then you have to allow it.
translation.ko: 내가 성인이 되길 원한다면 성인 대우를 해 주세요

translation.en: What's going on with Sam?
What is it?
Remember when she was little... ...she found that frog and we wouldn't let her keep it...
translation.ko: 어릴 때 개구리를 잡았는데 우리가 놔주라고 했더니

translation.en: ...and she got that really stubborn little... -...unbelievably cute look on her face? -Yes.
translation.ko: 앙증맞고 고집스런 표정을 지었던 거 기억나?

translation.en: She just made that face again.
Man, here I am, about to go on stage...
translation.ko: 이제 난 연단 위로 올라가려 하는데

translation.en: ...and she puts her old man in his place.
-Really? -Yeah, really.
And?
-...I don't know. Good for her. -It's time to go, Mr. President.
translation.ko: - 모르겠어, 참 장해 - 갈 시간입니다, 각하

translation.en: Ready?
Let's go.
And as for our president, he'll do to this country what she's done to her family.
translation.ko: 이제 대통령은 딸이 가족에게 했던 행동을 미국에 그대로 할 겁니다

translation.en: Embarrass it.
We've taken direct hits on the domestic agenda.
translation.ko: 국내 문제에 대해 우린 직격탄을 받아왔으니,

translation.en: -It's the last push before the election. -It's too late to change position.
-I don't think we should address it. -What do you think, Sam?
translation.ko: - 그건 언급할 필요가 없는 것 같아요 - 네 생각은 어때?

translation.en: -I don't really have an opinion, Dad. -Really?
Are you sure?
I don't know what could be more important than home.
translation.ko: 가정보다 더 중요한 게 뭐가 있겠어요

translation.en: Ladies and gentlemen, the president of the United States.
Thanks.
-Mr. President. -Afternoon, folks.
Thought you might want a snack.
translation.ko: 간식을 먹고 싶어 할 것 같아서

translation.en: Made it myself.
Okay, I had that cake made myself.
How are you doing?
I need you to make sure that James is okay.
He's a good agent.
-I'll see what I can do. -Thank you.
Did you love him?
I loved who I got to be with him.
translation.ko: 그와 함께 있을 때의 내 자신을 사랑했어요

translation.en: Even though I didn't do anything amazing...
...for me it was.
I felt like I knew myself for the first time.
translation.ko: 생전 처음으로 내 자신을 안 것 같은 기분이었죠

translation.en: Love?
That too.
That's what I thought.
And re-elected to a second term, President John Mackenzie.
Thank you very much. God bless the USA.
We love you, Mac!
Recently, this really fine young woman...
...pointed out to me the importance of home.
And for the next four years...
...this administration is going to find its way back there.
translation.ko: 이 행정부는 가정을 위한 정책을 추구할 것입니다

translation.en: Starting now. Thank you.
It's your time.
-The next dance is for you and me. -Okay.
What do you think of your father's policies now?
I have my own policies to think about.
translation.ko: 제 나름대로 생각해야 할 정책이 따로 있어서요

translation.en: -That was a nice speech. -Thanks.
One thing you always taught me was to make sure that I'm always at home...
translation.ko: 아빠가 내게 늘 가르쳐주신 건 늘 맘을 편히 하란 거였어요

translation.en: ...no matter what anyone else thinks.
It has to include you.
-We all deserve a second chance. -It's okay.
translation.ko: - 누구나 두 번째 기회란 있는 법이야 - 괜찮아요

translation.en: Give me your left hand.
-What are you doing? -Dancing with you.
On my shoulder.
We shouldn't. We can't.
Try not to lead this time, okay?
...believe this is yours.
It'll take you on your next trip.
translation.ko: 다음 여행 땐 이 차로 다니게 될 거야

translation.en: Even included the cooler.
We did everything to your exact specifications.
translation.ko: 네가 원하는 모든 걸 다 마련해뒀어

translation.en: Thank you, James.
Thank you.
Bye, Sam.
Now go try to break a few rules, huh?
translation.ko: 이제 규칙을 좀 깨려고 노력해 봐

translation.en: You try to keep some.
-Forget something? -Yeah.
I just forgot my purse.
Take good care of him.
I will.
Just getting back on duty now.
I'm just getting off duty now.
I hear she'll be home for spring break.
translation.ko: 봄 방학 때 집에 올 거라더군

translation.en: Just so you know.
You ready to stand on the sidelines of history?
Yeah. You?
-POTUS moving. -Yeah.
Just make sure you don't fall in love with this one.
Once upon a time, underneath the magic of the night sky...
...a brazen little girl grew up in a white house.
translation.ko: 하얀색 집에서 당찬 작은 소녀가 살고 있었어요

translation.en: It wasn't until she left that house, however, that she truly found home.
translation.ko: 하지만 그 집을 떠나고서야 비로소 진정한 집을 찾았죠

translation.en: College bound till spring, she'll be back when the cherry blossoms bloom again.
translation.ko: 봄이 되어 캠퍼스에 벚꽃이 피면 그 소녀는 집으로 돌아온답니다

translation.en: With romance in the air, James will be there.
translation.ko: 사랑을 머금은 채 제임스가 기다리고 있는 곳으로요

translation.en: But that's another story.
